categories.title: Uganda Popular Safaris
categories.description: Most requested Uganda safari programs including Gorilla and Chimpanzee tracking

subcategories.title: Gorilla & Chimpanzee Tracking
subcategories.intro: The name Bwindi refers to 'Impenetrable' in a local Bantu dialect! This gives a full description of Bwindi Impenetrable Forest National Park. The Forest N.P. was first gazetted as a Forest Reserve in 1942 and graduated into a National Park in 1992. The park later ascended to a platform of a World Heritage Site in December 1994 because of the diversity of wildlife that it harbors. Bwindi covers a total area of 327sqkms of a rugged landscape which are basically thick forested highlands. The longevity of the Bwindi forest that spans over 25,000yrs explains the collection of a litany of wildlife species such as 310 species of butterflies, 51 reptiles, 200 tree species, 88 moths and a remarkable 120 mammal species including 10 man-like (primate) species. Among the ape-residents are Chimpanzees, L' Hoist’s, red tailed and blue monkeys, black & white colobus monkeys, baboons and the highlight of the primate-world "The Great Mountain Gorillas"!! Bwindi is home to more than half of the remaining Mountain Gorillas on planet earth! Avid birdwatchers and ornithologists love exploring the diversity of birdlife that Bwindi supports. There are 350 recorded bird species most of which are Albertine Rift endemics thus not seen in other parts of East Africa
notes: Please note that gorilla tracking is a strenuous activity and one should be physically fit to enjoy this tour.
Anyone with signs of communicable diseases will NOT be allowed to track.
While possession of a gorilla permit is a guarantee of trekking and sighting the gorillas, the quality of the gorilla trekking cannot be guaranteed.
Maximum time allowed with the gorillas will NOT exceed ONE hour.
recommendedItems: Still Cameras and Video Cameras with their respective accessories
safariRequirements: Some cash to cover personal expenses like soft and alcoholic drinks
You may carry cameras and binoculars if you possess them
Enough dose for those who may be on medication
An extra pair of glasses for those with eye defects.

safaris.title: Gorilla Express Safari
safaris.description: A 4-day gorilla tracking safari to Bwindi Impenetrable National Park, offering the chance to encounter mountain gorillas in their natural habitat.

days.title: Kampala to Bwindi
days.description: Drive South west of Kampala, across the equator to Mbarara for lunch. Continue through spectacular sceneries of Kabale, to Buhoma in Bwindi National Park, Proceed to your tented camp for the night.

days.title: Gorilla Tracking - Bwindi
days.description: Early morning tracking with the guides in search for mountain Gorillas. Meals and overnight at the camp.

days.title: Second Gorilla Tracking - Kabale
days.description: Early morning gorilla tracking. Evening drive to Kabale for overnight.

days.title: Return to Kampala
days.description: After breakfast, return to Kampala via Mbarara for lunch.

safaris.title: The Great Apes Safari - Gorilla and Chimpanzee
safaris.destination: Kibale, Queen Elizabeth, Bwindi, Lake Mburo
safaris.description: A comprehensive 7-day safari combining chimpanzee tracking in Kibale Forest and gorilla tracking in Bwindi, with game drives in Queen Elizabeth National Park and Lake Mburo.

days.title: Entebbe/Kampala - Kibale Forest N.P.
days.description: Wake up to rhythm of nature, have breakfast, check-out and embark on a long scenic ride via Kampala Mityana and Mubende respectively to Fort Portal town. Continue to Kibale Forest National Park, settle-in at Primate Lodge and a hot meal shall be served. After lunch, embark on the scenic exploration of Kibale area for as long as time permits.

days.title: Chimpanzee Tracking - Queen Elizabeth N.P.
days.description: Early morning wake-up and have breakfast, attend briefing by the Ranger-guide and enter the sanctuary to embark on your morning Chimpanzee tracking session. Exit the park heading to Queen Elizabeth N.P. via Fort Portal and Kasese Towns. Take an introductory game drive as your transfer to the lodging facility.

days.title: Sunrise Game-drive - Kazinga Boat-Launch
days.description: Wake-up to the sounds of nature, embark on a sunrise game-drive. Look-out for lions, leopards, elephants, warthogs, bushbucks, cape buffaloes and waterbucks. After lunch, transfer to the pier for your afternoon boat-ride on Kazinga Channel.

days.title: To Ishasha - Bwindi Impenetrable Forest
days.description: After breakfast, take an en-route game drive as you exit Mweya Peninsular heading to Ishasha section renowned for tree-climbing lions. After picnic lunch, proceed to Bwindi Impenetrable Forest National Park.

days.title: Gorilla Tracking Day
days.description: Wake-up and prepare for the summit of your Uganda Safari; the encounter with the critically endangered Mountain Gorillas. Pack lunch, water and rain gear. After briefing, follow your ranger-guide into the gorilla sanctuary. On sight of the gorillas, keep calm and watch them feed, play and swing from branches. Maximum time allowed: ONE hour.

days.title: Bwindi - Lake Mburo N.P.
days.description: After breakfast, drive to Lake Mburo National Park. After lunch, enjoy a boat-ride on Lake Mburo offering opportunities to see Hippos, Nile Crocs. The birdlife is rich with 332 recorded species. On landing, enjoy a sundown game-drive to see Elands, Zebras, Impala and reedbucks.

days.title: Safari Walk - Return to Kampala
days.description: Follow your ranger-guide on an early morning Safari Walk. A unique opportunity to see wildlife on foot. After breakfast, take an en-route game drive as you exit the park. Stop at Equator Point for photo opportunity and shopping. Drop-off at Entebbe for onward flight.
includes: Meals per choice of lodging category
A liter of bottled water per day
excludes: Visas/Entry Permit for Uganda if required
Pre & Post Tour Accommodation in Kampala or Entebbe

safaris.title: Gorilla Express Safari - 5 Days
safaris.description: A 5-day gorilla tracking safari with transfers from Entebbe, offering a more relaxed pace with pre and post-tour accommodation.

days.title: Arrival - Kampala
days.description: Meet and assist upon arrival at Entebbe International Airport and transfer to your lodging facility in Entebbe or Kampala. Check-in, relax and rest for the evening.

days.title: Kampala - Bwindi Forest
days.description: At 0600hrs, meet and assist at your residence. Get on board and undergo safari briefing. Start journeying westwards. Stop at The Equator Point for photo-opportunity. Break for lunch in Mbarara Town. Follow snaking routes of Kigezi Highlands 'Switzerland of Africa'. Check-in at your reserved lodging facility.

days.title: Gorilla Tracking Day
days.description: Wake-up early, have breakfast, pack lunch and attend briefing by head-ranger. Get your walking-stick and follow your ranger-guide to track mountain gorillas. Once you locate them, keep calm and watch them play, feed and swing. Maximum time: ONE Hour. Return to base, receive tracking certificate and return to lodge.

days.title: Bwindi - Kampala/Entebbe
days.description: Wake-up to watch sunrise. Exploit your last moments with mountain gorillas. After breakfast, join your driver on long-picturesque drive with lunch break en-route. Check-in at lodging facility for the evening.

days.title: Entebbe - Flight Out
days.description: Morning at Leisure in Entebbe Peninsula, breakfast, check-out and transfer to Entebbe Airport for your onward flight out.

includes: A liter of bottled water per day
Accommodation in Bwindi for Two Nights
excludes: Visas/Entry Permit for Uganda if required

safaris.title: Gorilla Thriller/Express - 7 Days
safaris.description: A comprehensive 7-day gorilla safari from Nairobi, including two days of gorilla tracking and a visit to Lake Bunyonyi.

days.title: Nairobi - Kampala
days.description: Travel from Nairobi to Kampala. Overnight in a hotel in Kampala booked on bed and breakfast basis.

days.title: Kampala - Buhoma
days.description: Early morning start from Kampala to southwest across the equator. Drive through savannah grasslands seeing banana plantations and Ankole cattle. Ascend into Kigezi highlands 'Switzerland of Africa' with terraced farming. Drive through to Buhoma. Overnight in tented camp.

days.title: Buhoma - Gorilla Tracking
days.description: Enter sanctuary at dawn and enjoy the beauty of the forest, home to mountain gorillas. After briefing, proceed through dense bush to trek for these endangered species. Other primates include black and white colobus, redtail monkey and chimpanzee. Return to tented camp.

days.title: Buhoma - Second Gorilla Tracking
days.description: Re-enter the forest for a second exciting day of tracking. Return to your tented camp for dinner and overnight.

days.title: Buhoma - Lake Bunyonyi
days.description: Depart the forest for Lake Bunyonyi, the lake of little birds, renowned for its variety and abundance of avians. Enjoy a canoe ride on this beautiful narrow lake surrounded by green hills. Dinner and overnight in a hotel.

days.title: Lake Bunyonyi - Kampala
days.description: Return to Kampala after breakfast. Overnight in a hotel in Kampala.

days.title: Kampala - Nairobi
days.description: Early morning departure to Nairobi where you arrive in the late afternoon.

notes: The above package can be reduced to five days by eliminating day 4 and 5.
The return journey Nairobi-Kampala-Nairobi can be substituted with flights.
Trekkers are advised to bring heavy leather gloves, stout hiking boots, long sleeve shirts, long pants, a light backpack and a water bottle.
healthRegulations: Yellow fever and Cholera vaccinations are required
Tracking can be strenuous - one must be reasonably fit
Good boots and clothing covering arms and legs required for heavy rains and dense forest

categories.title: Uganda Balloon Safaris
categories.description: Hot air balloon experiences over Uganda's national parks

safaris.title: Hot Air Balloon Murchison Falls
safaris.description: Balloon safaris in Uganda are a recently introduced tourist activity by the Uganda Wildlife Authority (UWA) in the Murchison Falls National Park. Hot air ballooning is handled by Dream Balloons who are certified by Uganda Civil Aviation Authority, National Environment Management Authority, Uganda Wildlife Authority and Uganda Communications Commission.

images.alt: Hot Air Balloon over Murchison Falls

highlights: Certified pilots by Ugandan and Egyptian Aviation Authorities
Breathtaking aerial views of wildlife and landscapes

safaris.title: Queen Elizabeth National Park Balloon Safari
safaris.description: Experience breathtaking views of Uganda's wildlife and landscapes with a sunrise hot air balloon safari over Queen Elizabeth National Park. Float above elephants, lions, hippos, antelopes and the scenic Rwenzori Mountains.

days.title: Sunrise Balloon Safari
days.description: Pickup from lodges around 5:30 AM, transported to Kasenyi Gate. Safety briefing and refreshments (tea/coffee) while balloon inflates. Flight lasts approximately 1 hour, taking off around 6:15 AM. Altitudes range up to 760 meters (2,500 feet). The balloon drifts over Kazinga Channel, Ishasha Plains, crater lakes, Kyambura Gorge, Lake Edward, Lake George and the Rwenzori Mountains. Upon landing, enjoy bush breakfast prepared by Mweya Safari Lodge with sparkling juice. Receive souvenir balloon safari certificate.

highlights: Operated by Balloon Tours Uganda Ltd
Full refunds if weather prevents safe landing
Spot tree-climbing lions, elephants, buffaloes, hippos, leopards
Aerial views of rift valley escarpments and crater lakes
recommendations: Bring small daypack with camera and binoculars

categories.title: Uganda Flying Safaris
categories.description: Domestic flight connections to major safari destinations

subcategories.title: Flying Safari Destinations
subcategories.intro: Our Uganda Flying Safari Holidays fly you to the major safari and tour destinations around Uganda including: Kasese (Kibale), Mbarara (Lake Mburo), Jinja, Kaiso (Lake Albert), Kisoro (Mgahinga, Clouds), Chobe, Bulago, Fort Portal (Kibale), Kayonza (Bwindi, Buhoma), Kidepo, Mweya (Queen Elizabeth National Park), Semliki, Tororo (Mt. Elgon National Park), Kidepo Valley National Park (Apoka Airstrip), Kihihi (Queen Elizabeth National Park, Bwindi), Ishasha (Queen Elizabeth National Park, Bwindi), Pakuba (Murchison Falls National Park North Bank), Murchison Falls National Park at Bugungu (South Bank).

safaris.title: Uganda Luxury Flying Safari
safaris.destination: Entebbe, Murchison Falls, Queen Elizabeth, Bwindi
safaris.description: A flying safari gives you the opportunity to fly between each destination rather than by road, so you can spend more time enjoying game drives and experiencing luxury camps and lodges. This safari takes in Uganda's main National Parks that are linked easily by air.

destinations.name: Entebbe
destinations.description: Start your trip with a stay in a comfortable hotel with great views over the famous lake. With spa facilities, a golf course and a selection of restaurants. Located conveniently close to Entebbe airport.

destinations.name: Murchison Falls
destinations.description: After breakfast head to airport for short flight to Murchison Falls airstrip. Note: baggage limited to 15kg/33lbs for soft bag and 5kg/11lbs hand luggage. Met and taken straight on safari in 4x4 vehicle. Next day at leisure for full day vehicle safari, shorter drives or water-based activities including birding trip to delta.

destinations.name: Queen Elizabeth II National Park
destinations.description: Short hop to Queen Elizabeth National Park. Immediately start safari experience tailored to your desires. Explore Ishasha for tree climbing lions. Take water safari on Kazinga Channel to get close to hippos while watching wildlife drinking at water's edge.

destinations.name: Bwindi Impenetrable National Park
destinations.description: Drive through park to Bwindi. Early morning wake up for gorilla trekking. Allocated guide and gorilla family. Highly recommend hiring porter. After trek, freshen up and share stories before dinner. Morning flight back to Entebbe.

includes: All National Park fees and entrance fees
notes: Safari can be tailored to meet personal needs
Flexible length of trip and accommodation
Extra luggage needs can be discussed

safaris.title: Bwindi & Mgahinga Flying Safari
safaris.description: Fly to Bwindi Impenetrable National Park and Mgahinga National Park via Kihihi & Kisoro Airstrips. One of the most thrilling experiences in Uganda is gorilla trekking. These destinations lie approximately 500 kilometers from Entebbe, requiring 10-hour drive. Take one-hour domestic flight instead.

airstrips.name: Kisoro Airstrip
airstrips.serves: Southern Nkuringo & Rushaga Sectors of Bwindi and Mgahinga National Park

highlights: Breathtaking aerial views of southwestern landscapes
Flight experience compared to Nepal's rugged highlands

categories.title: Uganda Cultural and Sports Safaris
categories.description: Experience Uganda's rich cultural heritage and sporting activities

subcategories.title: Cultural Experiences
subcategories.intro: Uganda is a culturally diverse country that offers a range of unique and authentic experiences. From traditional villages to cultural festivals, traditional crafts to royal kingdoms, historical sites to community tourism, Uganda has something to offer everyone.

safaris.title: Uganda Cultural Experiences
safaris.description: Uganda is home to many indigenous communities that have preserved their unique cultures. Experience traditional villages, cultural festivals, crafts, cuisine, royal kingdoms, historical sites, music, dance and more.

culturalHighlights.title: Traditional Villages
culturalHighlights.description: Visit traditional villages and explore customs of Batwa pygmies in Bwindi, farming practices of Bagisu people in Mbale, or tribal culture of Karamojong people in northeast.

culturalHighlights.title: Cultural Festivals
culturalHighlights.description: Witness traditional dances, music and cultural practices. Nyege Nyege festival in Jinja celebrates African music and culture. Imbalu circumcision festival of Bagisu people in Mbale is unique cultural experience.

culturalHighlights.title: Traditional Crafts
culturalHighlights.description: Learn about traditional crafts such as weaving, pottery, and basketry. Ndere Centre in Kampala is great place to experience traditional dances, music, and cultural practices.

culturalHighlights.title: Traditional Food
culturalHighlights.description: Try traditional dishes such as matooke (mashed bananas), Luwombo (meat/chicken/fish wrapped in banana leaves), and local delicacies like roasted grasshoppers.

culturalHighlights.title: Royal Kingdoms
culturalHighlights.description: Explore ancient palaces of Buganda, Tooro, Bunyoro, and Busoga kingdoms. Learn about rich history and interact with royal families.

culturalHighlights.title: Historical Sites
culturalHighlights.description: Explore ancient rock paintings in Karamoja, Kabaka's palace in Kampala, or historic Kasubi Tombs (UNESCO World Heritage site).

culturalHighlights.title: Music and Dance
culturalHighlights.description: Traditional dances such as Bwola dance of Acholi people or Amagunjju dance of Baganda people. Attend live music performances in Kampala.

culturalHighlights.title: Religious Sites
culturalHighlights.description: Visit Namugongo Martyrs' Shrine (UNESCO World Heritage site) where 22 Ugandan martyrs were killed in 1886. Tour the Bahai Temple in Kampala.

culturalHighlights.title: Language Learning
culturalHighlights.description: Over 50 languages spoken. Take language classes or immerse in local community. English and Swahili are official languages.

culturalHighlights.title: Community Tourism
culturalHighlights.description: Stay in community-owned lodges, eat locally sourced food, participate in community activities. Supports local community development.

topExperiences.title: Visit the Buganda Kingdom
highlights: Visit Kasubi Tombs (UNESCO World Heritage Site)
Learn about Kabaka (king) role in modern Uganda

topExperiences.title: Batwa Cultural Experience
highlights: Visit Batwa Pygmies near Bwindi or Mgahinga
Traditional forest walks with Batwa guides
Learn about medicinal plants and hunting techniques

topExperiences.title: Karamojong Manyatta Visits
highlights: Engage in cattle herding and jewelry crafting
Hire local guide for deeper understanding

topExperiences.title: Ndere Cultural Centre
highlights: Attend cultural show with music, dance, storytelling
Features various ethnic groups in single evening
Perfect for visitors with limited time

topExperiences.title: Traditional Cuisine
highlights: Luwombo: meat/groundnut sauce in banana leaves
Rolex: rolled chapati with eggs and vegetables
Eshabwe: creamy ghee sauce from western Uganda

topExperiences.title: Igongo Cultural Centre
highlights: Heritage of Ankole and Bahima cultures
En route to Bwindi or Queen Elizabeth

topExperiences.title: Amabere Caves
highlights: Combine with Tooro royal palace tour

topExperiences.title: Traditional Handicrafts
highlights: Shop for baskets, beaded jewelry, bark cloth
Buganda Road Craft Market in Kampala

categories.title: Uganda Extreme Safaris
categories.description: Adventure activities and extreme sports in Uganda

safaris.title: White Water Rafting the Nile - The Overnighter 45 Km
safaris.description: Imagine camping on a secluded Island mid-river! This trip is undoubtedly the best way to experience the Nile. Rafting 45 Km in total, you will be exhilarated by the huge whitewater of day one. On day two we combine exciting rapids such as Nile Special and Mulalu with plenty of relaxation.

images.alt: White Water Rafting on the Nile

highlights: Drift among Busoga tribesmen in canoes
Swim and relax on the raft
Spot monkeys, Fish Eagles, Monitors, Otters
notes: Oar boat option available for more sedate trip
Guide rows with oars - just sit back and enjoy
Still thrills but not the spills

categories.title: Uganda Photographic & Scenery Safaris
categories.description: Photography-focused safari experiences showcasing Uganda's diverse landscapes

subcategories.title: Photographic Safari Destinations
subcategories.intro: Uganda, known as the 'Pearl of Africa,' offers a wealth of stunning photography locations, showcasing its diverse landscapes, rich wildlife, and vibrant cultures. Discover these top photography hotspots in Uganda that are sure to inspire your next photographic adventure.

safaris.title: Uganda Photography Locations
safaris.description: Uganda offers diverse natural beauty, rich wildlife, and vibrant cultures for photographers. From mountain gorillas to stunning waterfalls, volcanic landscapes to bustling cities.

topLocations.name: Bwindi Impenetrable National Park
topLocations.description: Renowned for mountain gorilla population. Once-in-a-lifetime opportunity to capture these endangered creatures up close in natural habitat.

topLocations.name: Queen Elizabeth National Park
topLocations.description: Diverse landscapes including savannah, wetlands, and forests. Home to elephants, lions, buffalo. Ideal for wildlife photography.

topLocations.name: Murchison Falls National Park
topLocations.description: Dramatic photo opportunities as Nile River surges through narrow gorge before plunging into Devil's Cauldron. Wide array of wildlife and diverse landscapes.

topLocations.name: Kidepo Valley National Park
topLocations.description: Remote park in northeastern Uganda. Stunning landscapes with rugged mountain ranges and vast savannah plains. Giraffes, zebras, and lions.

topLocations.name: Lake Bunyonyi
topLocations.description: Surrounded by terraced hillsides and dotted with small islands. Picturesque setting for landscape photography and local culture.

topLocations.name: Rwenzori Mountains National Park
topLocations.description: Home to legendary 'Mountains of the Moon'. Striking mountain landscapes, unique flora, and trekking photography opportunities.

topLocations.name: Sipi Falls
topLocations.description: Located in eastern Uganda. Series of three stunning waterfalls cascading down slopes of Mount Elgon. Spectacular photo opportunities.

topLocations.name: Kampala
topLocations.description: Bustling capital city with urban photography opportunities. Street scenes, markets, historic landmarks like Kasubi Tombs and Uganda National Mosque.

topLocations.name: Mgahinga Gorilla National Park
topLocations.description: Mountain gorillas and rare golden monkeys. Unique wildlife photography in stunning volcanic landscapes.

topLocations.name: Lake Mburo National Park
topLocations.description: Small but diverse park. Acacia woodlands, wetlands, and savannah plains. Home to zebras, impalas, and leopards.

categories.title: Uganda Excursions
categories.description: Day trips and short excursions in Uganda

safaris.title: Uganda Excursions
safaris.description: Various day excursions available throughout Uganda. Content to be provided.

safaris.title: Uganda Day Trip
safaris.description: Day trip options in Uganda. Content to be provided.

categories.title: Uganda Top Requested Safaris
categories.description: Most popular safari programs in Uganda

safaris.title: Murchison Falls
safaris.description: A 3-day budget safari to Murchison Falls National Park, featuring game drives and a boat cruise to the breathtaking falls.

days.title: Kampala to Paraa
days.description: Drive through Luwero triangle, arriving at Masindi for Lunch. Proceed to the park for game drive with overnight at paraa.

days.title: Murchison Falls Exploration
days.description: After an early morning game drive, take a boat cruise along the Nile to the bottom of the breath taking falls. After lunch, drive to the top of the falls. Overnight at Paraa.

days.title: Return to Kampala
days.description: After breakfast, return to Kampala via Masindi for lunch.

safaris.title: Queen Elizabeth - Kibale Forest
safaris.description: A 4-day budget safari combining Queen Elizabeth National Park and Kibale Forest for primate tracking.

days.title: Kampala to Mweya
days.description: Head towards western Uganda. Stop over at the local drum industry, the equator, Masaka, and Mbarara for lunch. Evening game drive proceeding to Mweya for the night.

days.title: Queen Elizabeth Park
days.description: Drive through volcanic formations of the western Rift Valley. The descent reveals stunning panorama of Lakes George and Edward. After game drives and lunch, take a boat trip on the Kazinga channel. Resume game viewing before returning to lodge.

days.title: Kibale Forest - Fort Portal
days.description: After breakfast, depart for Kibale forest to track a variety of primate species. Overnight at the hotel.

days.title: Return to Kampala
days.description: After breakfast, return to Kampala via Mubende.

safaris.title: Kenya / Tanzania Safari
safaris.description: An 11-day safari covering the best of Kenya and Tanzania, including tree hotels, Samburu, Lake Nakuru, Lake Manyara, Serengeti and Ngorongoro Crater.

days.title: Tree Hotel
days.description: Morning drive to the forested highlands of the Aberdares. After lunch at the base hotel, transfer to your tree hotel for game watching at the floodlit water hole.

days.title: Samburu
days.description: Continue north across the equator to the home of the samburu people. Marvel at the rugged scenery of isolated crags and springs. After a game drive, relax in the comfort of your lodge.

days.title: Samburu Game Viewing
days.description: Morning and afternoon game drives along the Uaso Nyiro river. View carnivores and rare herbivores such as the Beisa oryx or the Grevy zebra.

days.title: Lake Nakuru
days.description: Drive to Lake Nakuru with stunning vistas between the escarpments of the Rift Valley. During game drive, behold the sight of pink flamingoes lining the alkaline lake.

days.title: Nairobi
days.description: After breakfast, depart for Nairobi, arriving before lunch. Afternoon at your leisure.

days.title: Lake Manyara
days.description: Cross the border to Tanzania at Namanga, stopping at Arusha for Lunch. Proceed to Lake Manyara for a game drive. Spend the night at the Lake Manyara Hotel.

days.title: Serengeti National Park
days.description: After breakfast, drive to Serengeti National Park via the Ngorongoro Conservation Area. Enjoy a picnic lunch en-route. Afternoon game drive in Serengeti.

days.title: Serengeti Game Drives
days.description: Full day of game drives in Serengeti National Park with picnic lunch. Explore the vast plains and witness the incredible wildlife.

days.title: Ngorongoro Crater
days.description: Drive to Ngorongoro Crater after breakfast. Descend into the crater for a full day of game viewing with picnic lunch.

days.title: Arusha - Nairobi
days.description: Return to Arusha for lunch before crossing back into Kenya. Arrive in Nairobi in the late afternoon.

days.title: Departure
days.description: Transfer to Nairobi airport for your onward flight.
